site_data.configure_Sites_Data: [ 'NAME', 'Start by telling us what sites (physical locations) that OPĀQ will protect.' ]
site_data.delete_Msgbox_Text1: [ 'Are you sure you want to delete TEST CAPTURED?', 'Upon deleting all data for TEST CAPTURED will be lost.' ]
site_data.site_Information_HelpText:
Specify a name for the Site. This name will be used for the Site drop-down in Dashboards.
The Site is allocated an external IP address by OPĀQ. This will be available after the OPĀQ Admin has activated this Site. This is the IP address that external servers / Internet will see for all traffic from this Site. Please make sure that any external servers that restrict access based on your Site's IP address have been informed about this IP address.
Specify the location type based on the primary function of the Site.
Define tags as keywords you would use to describe the Site.
Tell us roughly how many users are on the network at this Site.
site_data.site_PhysicalLocation_HelpText:
Specify the physical address of the Site. OPĀQ will use this information to identify an appropriate data center to connect the Site to.
The Point Of Contact information will be used by OPĀQ for initial connectivity, as well as later for sending alerts for any possible issues seen with this Site.
site_data.site_NetworkSettings_HelpText:
Specify the details about the Internet Service Provider you have at this Site for external connectivity. OPĀQ uses this information to connect your Site with OPĀQ’s cloud infrastructure.
The IP Address should be your external IP address at the Site – the address that OPĀQ can use to reach your Site. Gateway and Netmask are also needed from your ISP if we are provisioning an Edge Device for you.
Specify similar details for a secondary ISP, if you have more than one ISP at this Site and would like to create a redundant connection.
site_data.site_OPAQVPNDevice_HelpText:
Select this option if you plan to use a VPN Device from OPĀQ for connecting to OPĀQ’s cloud-based solution.
Specify the IP address and Netmask you would assign to OPĀQ’s Device within your network.
Specify internal Next Hop address for any internal subnets as Gateway.
site_data.site_OtherVPNDevice_HelpText:
Select this option if you plan to use your own Device from OPĀQ for connecting to OPĀQ’s cloud-based solution.
Specify the IP address you would assign to your Device within your network.
OPĀQ Operations may contact you to ask for additional information about your Device. You can provide that information here as Device Details.
site_data.site_DataCenterCrossConnection_HelpText:
Select this option if you plan to setup a cross-connect from your Site to OPĀQ’s data center.
Select a supported hand-off type and provide requested bandwidth for the cross-connect.
Specify the Peer IP address that would be seen by OPĀQ for your side of the connection. Your ISP should be able to provide this information.
site_data.site_InternalSubnets_HelpText: List all Subnets that exist at this Site. Use netmasks or IP address ranges for identifying each Subnet.
site_data.site_InternetFacingServers_HelpText:
List all Servers at this Site that need connectivity from the Internet or other external networks.
You will be able to define access policies for these later on, under the Policy tab.
These Servers are given an external IP address by OPĀQ that will be displayed next to the internal IP. These will be available after the OPĀQ Admin has activated this Site and added these Servers. You will need to use this external IP addresses to access your Servers from external networks. If these Servers are accessible via Domain Names, you will need to modify appropriate DNS entries to point to the external IP addresses provided.
Externally accessible Servers should be isolated from other internal systems within your network. Contact OPĀQ if you would like help with internal network segmentation.
site_data.portTranslation_HelpText:
Port translations can also be defined for each server. It is possible for us to map different ports from the same external IP address to different internal servers at different internal IP addresses.
If you want us to do this, use the same “name” when defining each server that should share an address.

adminPage_data.helpSelectAdministrator:
Definition of roles:
Global Administrator: Authorized to troubleshoot issues with OPĀQ support, request changes to the solution or add more Administrators to the account.
Change Administrator: Authorized to troubleshoot issues with OPĀQ support or request changes to the solution. May not add or manage Administrators.
Trouble Shooting Administrator: Engages with OPĀQ support for troubleshooting any open issues. May not request changes to the solution or manage Administrators.
Dashboard User: Has access to Dashboards only and is typically not an administrator for the system.
adminPage_data.helpAdmin_ContactInfo:
Provide contact information for the Administrator.
The passphrase will be used for identifying the Administrator if this Administrator contacts OPĀQ support over the phone. Administrators must know their passphrases before making a call to OPĀQ support. Use phrases that are easy to remember yet hard to guess.
adminPage_data.helpAdminSelectSites: Select the Sites that are associated with the Administrator. Check all if the Administrator is allowed to work on all the Sites.

directoryServicesPage_data.directoryServices_Text: [ 'TYPE', 'Now, provide Active Directory information, if you plan to integrate directory services with the solution.' ]
directoryServicesPage_data.directoryServices_nextButtonText: Add Hosts that would be accessible from internet.
directoryServicesPage_data.directoryServicesName_errorMsg: Ensure this field has at least 3 characters.
directoryServicesPage_data.directoryServicesBaseDN_errorMsg: Ensure this field has at least 3 characters.
directoryServicesPage_data.directoryServicesBindDN_errorMsg: Ensure this field has at least 3 characters.
directoryServicesPage_data.directoryServicesPWD_errorMsg: Ensure this field has at least 3 characters.
directoryServicesPage_data.helpDS_Name:
Active Directory (AD) integration allows OPĀQ to associate your network traffic with users in your organization, and enables policies to be defined based on users and user groups.
At this time OPĀQ supports Microsoft Active Directory. Other LDAP solutions will be added at a later time.
Specify a name for your AD with at least three characters.
directoryServicesPage_data.helpDSBase_BindDN:
Specify Base DN and Bind DN in the format as provided as a placeholder:
Base DN: “DC=corp,DC=opaq,DC=com”
Bind DN: “CN=user1,CN=users, DC=corp,DC=opaq,DC=com”
Specify whether your AD requires a SSL/TLS based secure connection.
OPĀQ needs a service username and password to connect to your AD and be able to retrieve data from it. Once stored, the password will not be visible, but you will be able to replace it with a new password as needed.
directoryServicesPage_data.helpDSUserName_Password:
Specify Base DN and Bind DN in the format as provided as a placeholder: Base DN: “DC=corp,DC=opaq,DC=com” and Bind DN: “CN=user1,CN=users,DC=corp,DC=opaq,DC=com”.
Specify whether your AD requires SSL/TLS based secure connection.
directoryServicesPage_data.helpDSServer_Port: Specify the internal IP address of your AD Server and the port number. If you have multiple AD Servers, please list them all here.

urlFiltering_Page_Data.securityControls_Text: 'Blocks attempts to gain unauthorized access to your network by targeting and exploiting vulnerabilities.', 'Enables scanning of inbound documents, binary files, and compressed archives for viruses, worms, trojans, and spyware.', 'Blocks outbound communications from your network to know spyware command and control sites.', 'Default URL Filters', 'Strict URL Filters', 'Relaxed URL Filters', ''
urlFiltering_Page_Data.threatManagement_Text: Blocks attempts to gain unauthorized access to your network by targeting and exploiting vulnerabilities.
urlFiltering_Page_Data.antiVirus_Text: Enables scanning of inbound documents, binary files, and compressed archives for viruses, worms, trojans, and spyware.
urlFiltering_Page_Data.antiSpyware_Text: Blocks outbound communications from your network to know spyware command and control sites.

zones_Page_Data.zone_Help_Text: To allow access amongst systems, you may define groups of computer hosts as Host Groups. A Host Group is defined as a group of related IP addresses, subnets or IP address ranges. Host Groups are used for defining policies under the Policy tab.

policies_Page_Data.inBoundPoliciesText: By default, all servers are inaccessible from networks outside your organization. Policies can be added here to allow servers to be accessed from external networks.
policies_Page_Data.inBoundColumns:

policies_Page_Data.interZonePolicies_Text: Add Internal Network Policies to allow access within internal network.
policies_Page_Data.outBoundPolicies_Text: By default, all Host Groups are blocked to internet and external servers. This access is filtered through the security controls turned on for the solution. Policies can be added here to allow further access based on business needs.

fileBlock_Page_Data.help_text:
Specify the file types that need to be block. For example: "exe" (executable files), from being uploaded/downloaded.
Specify Applications exceptions to File Block. For example: while blocking exe files, you can allow Applications "ms-updates" and "adobe-updates" to allow their "exe" files for updates.
Specify domains for which the File Block should not apply. For example, if you allow any downloads from www.apple.com, you can list it here.
If you need additional assistance, please contact OPĀQ support.
